sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: As coronavirus cases continue to reach record-breaking heights in France, a lack of hospital staff puts the healthcare system under strain.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Time to say goodbye. Germany moves further away from nuclear energy as the country closes another power plant.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: France experiences its warmest winter yet with the mild weather leading to many ski cancellations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Calls for more regulations in space, as billionaires such as Elon Musk send thousands of satellites into orbit without restrictions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: 20% of intensive care beds in the Ile-de-France region are closed due to lack of personnel.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: That's according to the deputy director of Delafontaine Hospital near Paris, who says a significant number of healthcare workers now have the Omicron variant, even though they are obligated to be vaccinated.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: As daily Covid infections reach dizzying new heights, staff worry about their capacity to receive more cases.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: 90% of coronavirus inpatients have not been vaccinated.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Today the teams managed to hold on because there is still meaning in coming into work in the hospitals despite discouragement, despite exhaustion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: despite exhaustion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The truth is, especially during the fifth wave, these teams are pouring the last of their strength into treating, for the most part, patients that we would not have had if they had been vaccinated.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: This follows Health Minister Olivier Viron's announcement on Monday that France could reach more than 250,000 daily COVID cases by the beginning of January.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: As a week of unrestricted christmas parties and family get-togethers fuel the spread of the disease however the exponential growth in case numbers has pushed medical staff to the brink it's difficult we feel like we're going back to the situation we experienced two years ago there are patients who are not properly taken care of and above all, we have to come back from our holidays to face this new wave." While President Emmanuel Macron has vowed to crank up restrictions, the French Federation of Hospitals has called on the government to protect public clinics.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The unions say tighter measures are necessary to safeguard emergency wards and prevent more operations from being cancelled.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: It's the end of an era as Germany's nuclear phase-out enters its penultimate phase.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Three nuclear power plants will be taken off the grid on December 31st.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Symbolically, one of them is the Brockdorf nuclear power plant, which became a target of protest by opposition to nuclear power in the 1980s.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: At midnight on New Year's Eve, it shut down, much to its overseers' disdain.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The last few days have been accompanied by a fair amount of melancholy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: We have operated the plant for 35 years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: We looked after it, we kept it at the best technical level and we always operated it safely." No trace of melancholy is felt by Carsten Hinrichsen, a long-time anti-nuclear activist, also known as the Brockdorf rebel.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: I'm quietly but steadily rejoicing that the thing is now shut down.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: This is not euphoria.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Some people ask me if this is a victory.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: No, it's not.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: It's taken far too long for that." In 2011, the then Christian Democrat government under Angela Merkel reversed the decision to extend Germany's usage of nuclear plants after the Fukushima disaster in Japan earlier that year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The eight oldest reactors were shut down immediately, with the remaining nine to follow in stages until 2022.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: After Brockdorf, five plants still remain.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Grand, Emsland, Gundremingen, Isar and Neckar-Weschtain will go offline by the end of next year, completing the 11-year phase-out.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Germany is firmly resisting attempts by the EU Commission to classify nuclear energy as a sustainable technology.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It is also fine-tuning the expansion of renewable energies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: By 2030, 80% of the country's electricity is to come from wind turbines, solar panels or biogas plants.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Bordeaux residents are making the most of the good weather, as France experiences the

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: warmest winter in its history.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: That's according to the forecast of Meteo France, with temperatures 10 degrees warmer than average in some regions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: This man is enjoying the good weather and says that it's nice to be out and about.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: No complaints, though, especially not from restauranteurs, who are delighted with the extra bit of footfall.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: It's been a beautiful week, this man says, and despite all that's going on, people are making the most of it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: While in Switzerland, ski-goers are not happy. The milder weather results in rainfall, bringing the winter activities at ski resorts to a halt like this one in Grindelwald.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It's not so great everything is quite wet but we make the best out of it. Now we're here and there's still a bit of snow.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: And mild weather increases the risk of avalanches.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: In Savoie the recent weather has raised concerns over a possible snowfall.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Claude Schneider, a ski patroller and rescue worker in La Plagne, observes the snow cover several times a day.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: You should know that fresh light snow in very good condition weighs about 40 to 50 kilos per cubic meter. And at the time of the 1pm reading, it weighed 250 kilos per cubic metre, which is very bad for the risk of avalanches.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: According to environmentalists, a succession of warmer winters is probably a direct impact from climate change.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: For those braving the slopes, the extra few layers might not be needed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Tens of thousands of Dutch people have been quitting the country to enjoy the festive season away from the government-imposed lockdown.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: But in this Belgian border town, it's fireworks thereafter.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: I ordered a cracking beast, temptation, some Polish arrows and four mortar arrows.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Fireworks are prohibited in the Netherlands, but you don't mind.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It is a difficult and tough year for everyone.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: You have to end it in a nice way.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Despite the problem of how to set them off legally, many aren't skimping on the budget.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: I spent almost a thousand euros.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And that's worth it?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Yes of course.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Shopkeepers are delighted, but not everyone's pleased.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: I live in this street. They're on my doorstep, and my son's too. It's crazy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Belgian, Dutch and German authorities have appealed to Dutch people not to cross the borders to dodge their country's lockdown.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Vienna is hosting a war-era exhibition that seeks to address Austria's role in the Holocaust.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It's a result of research into the thousands of paintings, tapestries and sculptures that once belonged to the Third Reich's artistic association.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The curators say that displaying a selection of these unknown pro-Nazi works helps Austrians confront an ugly chapter in their history.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The denazification phase was a very short one and almost all of these artists returned to the art business after 1945, 1947 or at the latest after 1950.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: No one asked about their links with National Socialism.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: They still got state commissions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: So we also have some examples here of artists who were, so to speak, active after the war." When the Nazi regime secured control of Vienna's art world, creators were forced to comply with the Reich's agenda or face deportation and sometimes murder in concentration camps. I believe that these current discussions show that there is still a great need to reappraise history.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: That there are still many gaps and that these gaps need to be filled.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Because only if we understand this history, or history in general, or get to know it, can we draw conclusions and lessons from it?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The curators have sought to avoid giving a platform to these pro-Nazi works by using just rooms rather than the museum's large halls and explaining their political context.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The show runs until April.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The show runs until April.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: You're watching Euronews now. We'll be back with more shortly.
